name: Which Template
author: TheOnlineHero - Tom Skroza

sections.description: It’s really difficult to find out which template your page is using, especially when your looking at the front-end of your site. With this plugin it makes it much easier. When you view your site, you will see an admin menu item called, “Template file: …”. If you click on this link, you will be navigated to the template in a new tab. This plugin will save you hours of time.
sections.installation:
1) Install WordPress 5.6 or higher

2) Download the latest from:

https://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/which-template

3) Login to WordPress admin, click on Plugins / Add New / Upload, then upload the zip file you just downloaded.

4) Activate the plugin.
sections.changelog:
4.1

  • I updated namespacing.

4.0

  • You can now see which header, footer and sidebar template your using on your page.

3.0

  • Much better engine for working out which template is used on a page.

2.0

  • This version allows you to see if a page is using the page.php, single.php, 404.php, archive.php, tag.php, category.php or search.php template.

1.0

  • Initial Commit

short_description: Work out which template your page is currently looking at.
description: It’s really difficult to find out which template your page is using, especially when your looking at the front-end of your site. With this plugin it makes it much easier. This plugin will save you hours of time.
